amendment.description: Amendment provides 180 days of transitional health care to those service members who separate honorably from active duty and agree to serve in the Guard or Selected Reserve at no charge to the service member. It would offset the cost by cutting $22 million from the Missile Defense Agency.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 52 printed in House Report 110-666 to provide 180 days of transitional health care to those service members who separate honorably from active duty and agree to serve in the Guard or Selected Reserve at no charge to the service member. It would offset the cost by cutting $22 million from the Missle Defense Agency.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Bishop (GA) amendment (A015) Agreed to by voice vote.
